products.title: Ancho Beef and Bulgur Chili
products.body_html:
While chili purists might argue the virtues of a beanless bowl, the fiber in beans keeps you feeling satisfied and may also help regulate blood pressure and boost heart health. To ramp up the fiber even more, add bulgur, a type of cracked wheat that's a ground beef lookalike and adds even more meaty texture.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 45 min
  • Allergens: Dairy, Wheat
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:
  • Nutrition Facts

Suggested Pairings:

  • Malbec

products.title: "Saturday Morning Special" Cake Jars
products.body_html:
Inspired by the favorite past time of watching Saturday morning cartoons with a big bowl of cereal, this playful dessert will have all the kids, and the kids at heart, wide eyed and smiling in seconds. Colorful and whimsical, these jars are equal parts cute and delicious! Dig in and discover that each bite is filled with the delicious flavors of vanilla cake, buttercream frosting, fruity and fun cereals, and, of course,  sprinkles. Perfect for any celebration or while watching your favorite cartoons on TV with friends! 

  • Est. Cooking Time: 1.5 hr
  • Allergens: Dairy, Egg, Wheat, Soy

products.title: "Till Death by Chocolate Do Us Part" Cake Jars
products.body_html:
Calling all chocolate lovers! This luscious dessert is THE one for you. Behind these witty chocolate painted jars is an absolute chocolate flavor bomb. Bite after bite will have you discovering the amazing combination of moist chocolate cake, rich chocolate ganache, cookie crumbles, chopped up candy bars with nuts and caramel, fresh strawberries and cream cheese frosting for a contrast that brings it all together. You’ll want to dig into these until death by chocolate does you part.

products.title: 4-Hour Pulled Pork Tacos
products.body_html:
Get your Game Day face on with a south of the border favorite, authentic tacos. A rub of ancho chilies, coffee and cocoa create an unbelievably flavorful braised pork shoulder that is incredibly tender and ultimately shreddable. Served in warm tortillas and topped with pickled jalapeño, red onion and avocado mash. Your guests will agree that you’ve just scored big time!

products.title: 40 Cloves Garlic Chicken
products.body_html:
This classic chicken dish exemplifies everything we love about French bistro fare. It’s simple, rich, comforting and laced with lots of sweet garlic flavor. All 40 of those garlic cloves soften and melt during cooking to create a savory sauce that is out-of-this-world. While the chicken braises, turn exotic purple potatoes into a rustic mash. A splash of lemon at the end will boost the color of this antioxidant-filled side dish.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 45 min

products.title: 5 Minute Apple Crisp
products.body_html:
If you're looking for a sweet afternoon snack or a tasty treat to end a meal, look no further! These individual apple crisps are delicious and quick and easy to make! Sweet apples are tossed with cinnamon and brown sugar and topped with a Quaker® Simply Granola topping that is full of texture and flavor. A few minutes in the microwave transforms the apples and oats into a dessert that is comforting and reminiscent of apple pie but without the fuss. You'll enjoy every bite!

products.title: Acai Bowl
products.body_html:
You’ll be so glad this irresistible berry found its way from South America to your breakfast table! Whether you’re sitting down for the first meal of the day or sprinting out the door, you’ll love this fast and healthy breakfast bowl made with acai and almond milk and topped with granola. products.title: Ahi Poke
products.body_html:
Mention regional foods to Hawai’ians and poke will come to mind. If poke is new to you, consider it a tropical island version of sashimi, tartare, or carpaccio. In our dish, fresh ginger and chilies accent the diced Ahi tuna that you’ll combine with crisp Asian pears, tasty pine nuts, and chunks of creamy avocado. Crispy wontons are layered with a slaw of cool cucumbers and crunchy jicama. Drizzle an authentic sauce imbued with piquant wasabi and tamari and you’re on your way to paradise. Aloha!

  • Est. Cooking Time: 30 min
  • Allergens: Tree Nut, Wheat, Soy, Fish
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:
  • Nutrition Facts

products.title: Ahi Tuna Bruschetta
products.body_html:
This is a great dish from the menu at RPM and is loaded with flavor, freshness, color, and crunch. First, beautiful, delicate ahi is piled atop seasoned, toasted brioche slathered with a simple basil aioli. Served alongside a hearty salad of kale, smoky bacon and earthy mushrooms, this dish knows no season it’s as perfect for a summer meal outside with friends as it is for a cozy winter supper with your family.

products.title: Alaskan Cod
products.body_html:
Crispy, panko-crusted cod bakes alongside tender asparagus and juicy cherry tomatoes in this fast and flavorful sheet pan supper. The snowy white fish filet is mild yet firm, and pairs perfectly with a Spicy Rémoulade made with zesty lemon, fresh garlic and herbs, and a pop of heat from Southern-style hot sauce. Chef Virginia Willis says, “This wild-caught Alaskan Cod is harvested from an abundant fishery and is deemed sustainable by the Monterey Bay Aquarium Seafood Watch Program. It’s good, good for you, and good for the ocean”. 

  • Est. Cooking Time: 30 min
  • Allergens: Egg, Wheat, Fish
  • Skill Level:

products.title: Albondigas Soup
products.body_html:
Need comfort food? This albondigas soup from Casa Vega is the perfect antidote for any winter blues you may be feeling. The savory meatballs, vegetables, and warm broth come together to create a rich and satisfying soup that is full of the traditional flavor you’d expect from this classic dish. This is Mexican comfort food at its best.

products.title: All Day Breakfast Hash
products.body_html:
Chef Matty Matheson developed this recipe after many late nights with his friends, drinking and catching a punk concert. After the show, to impress his friends, he’d empty out the fridge and make a huge meal, using just one or two pans to minimize the mess. This completely crave-worthy hash is a direct descendant of those wild nights. Serve in the morning, afternoon or as a late-night snack, its perfect for anytime.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 45 min

products.title: Almond Butter Toast
products.body_html:
Almond butter is packed with protein. Bananas are loaded with potassium. Chia seeds provide healthy omega-3s. Put them all together as a tasty topping for this crunchy toast made from sprouted grains and you have a super-fast breakfast that’s also deliciously healthy. If you’re in a rush (or even if you aren’t) this is a nutritious way to begin your busy day.

  • Allergens: Tree Nut, Dairy, Wheat, Soy

products.title: Almond Crusted Chicken
products.body_html:
This almond crusted chicken and kale salad is so full of fun textures and flavors. It’s made up of ribbon-like Parmesan shavings, salty capers, bright lemon, and silky kale and crunchy almond chicken. The flavor and texture of the almond crusted chicken compliment the massaged kale perfectly! Topped with a lemon Dijon vinaigrette, this salad makes mindful eating a delight.

products.title: Almond Crusted Chocolate Truffles
products.body_html:
These vegan chocolate truffle are truly simple, using a quick method and only 3 ingredients. Heat the coconut milk, melt the chocolate, stir, chill and scoop! It’s as easy as that. The chocolate truffles are dairy-free, but still so creamy and rich. These perfectly treats are perfect to snack on or to share on a special occasion. When you want a minimalist dessert without the mixing and the kneading and the baking, these vegan chocolate truffles are the perfect choice.

  • Skill Level:

products.title: Amaretto French Toast and Candied Bacon
products.body_html:
Sunday morning has never tasted so good. The Amaretto French Toast by Purewow is truly tantalizing. Fluffy stacks of brioche bread are soaked in egg injected with vanilla, Amaretto syrup, and a touch of cinnamon creates rich and flavorful
French toast like you’ve never experienced. Accompanied by heaps of fresh berries, scrambled eggs and, of course, strips of hearty bacon, you’ll create a filling plate filled with all of your breakfast favorites.

products.title: Ancho Caramel Glazed Pork Tenderloin
products.body_html:
Growing up in Providence, Rhode Island, one of my favorite restaurants has always been Al Forno. Their menu features a “Dirty Steak,” which is a steak that they cook directly on the coals so it has this incredible char unlike anything I’ve ever tasted. They serve the steak with a straight caramel sauce to offset the bitterness of the deep coal flavor. I wanted to replicate that combination of flavors using a different cut of meat and a different technique.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 55 min
  • Allergens: Dairy, Wheat, Soy, Fish
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:
  • Nutrition Facts

Suggested Pairings:

  • Zinfandel
  • Quadrupel

products.title: Ancho Chili Hanger Steak
products.body_html:
Including ground coffee in a steak rub may seem unconventional but it adds a great depth of flavor - a warm and slightly bitter addition to the rich steak. The steak gets a fiery kick from the ancho chili powder and the brown sugar adds a wonderful caramelized flavor to the steak as it sears.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 20 min
  • Allergens: None
  • Skill Level:

products.title: Ancho Shrimp Taco
products.body_html:
“Taco Night” gets an upgrade in this recipe with smoky shrimp and creamy, crunchy slaw. Sautéing large shrimp with ancho chili powder makes for a rich flavor—cook for a few minutes on each side and the shrimp will be juicy and plump. No fish taco is complete without a slaw, and this one gets added nutrition from the red cabbage and a flavor boost from fresh lime juice. Beans and rice come together in a one-pot side dish that blends fragrant jasmine rice and black beans to complete the meal.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 25 min
  • Allergens: Dairy, Shellfish
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:
  • Nutrition Facts

Suggested Pairings:

  • Pinot Gris
  • Mexican Style Lager

products.title: Ancho-Rubbed Hanger Steak
products.body_html:
Fire up the grill—the sizzle of success is calling your name! Chef Brendan McDermott helps spice up the average steak night with this simple-to-make meal that he dreamed up just for our grilling class. We love how the ancho adds a touch of heat to the juicy steak, while the charred green bean salad makes for a palate-pleasing complement. Best of all, it’s a great way to keep everyone at the table happy... without spending hours in the kitchen.

Chef Brendan McDermott's online class, 25 Essential Grilling Techniques, is available now on Craftsy.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 60 min

products.title: Apple Cider-Chicken Salad
products.body_html:
The WeightWatchers program has been helping people to create new, healthy dietary and lifestyle habits since the early 60’s. Customized to fit your life, you can choose between all the foods you love and lose the weight for good. This filling, delicious low-calorie, low-fat chicken salad will amaze you. From crisp apple cider vinegar to tangy blue cheese to toasty pecans, you’ll be satisfied - and continue on your path to long-term weight loss success.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 30 min
  • Allergens: Tree Nut, Dairy

products.title: Apple Cranberry Brie Tart
products.body_html:
Sweet, crisp apples, creamy brie, and tart cranberry sauce come together to create a unforgettable appetizer that is perfect for your holiday entertaining. It’s rich, savory, and utterly luxurious. The best part, is that you can whip it up in 30 minutes or less, leaving you plenty of time to enjoy holiday celebrations with your family and friends.

products.title: Apple Glazed Pork Chops
products.body_html:
This is the kind of meal that will make you feel like a rock star chef. It’s full of complex flavors, contrasting textures, and interesting ingredients. A perfectly seared, golden pork chop topped with a sweet and tangy glaze is the star of this dish. The glaze combines crisp apples with apricot jam, and then a splash of balsamic vinegar takes it from sweet to savory. You’ll also make side dishes that bring color to the plate and pack a huge nutritional punch. Nutty brown rice and soft lentils make a unique pilaf, and bright Swiss chard cooks down to a tender pile of greens.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 50 min
  • Allergens: Tree Nut, Dairy
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:

products.title: Apple Pancakes
products.body_html:
These apple cider pancakes are the ultimate breakfast treat. They have all of the amazing flavor of an apple cider donut, but no where near as much guilt. You can whip these golden brown beauties up in under a half hour – no trip to the apple orchard required. Not only do these intensely fluffy pancakes taste like fall, the smooth caramel maple syrup adds a decadent layer of rich flavor.

products.title: Apple Pie
products.body_html:
One of the great pie makers in New York City was Kierin Baldwin, the pastry chef at The Dutch in  SoHo. This Thanksgiving recipe is adapted from hers, for a plain apple pie. It benefits from her advice to cook the filling before baking. “Apple pies that have crunchy, raw apples in them are a pet peeve of mine,” Ms. Baldwin said. Be sure to allow the mixture to cool completely before using it in the pie.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 2 hr
  • Allergens: Dairy, Egg, Wheat

products.title: Apple-Brandied Pork Chops
products.body_html:
A perfectly seared, golden pork chop topped with a sweet and tangy glaze is the star of this dish. The glaze is made up of Fuji apples, maple syrup, brandy, and Dijon mustard taking it from sweet to savory. The smashed potatoes and carrots pair perfectly to complete this 20-minute dish. You won't believe how quick and easy it is to cook up a meal this complex and flavorful.

products.title: Apricot Chicken with Teriyaki Tzimmers
products.body_html:
When you bring unexpected things together, you're bound to create something extraordinary. Tzimmes is a traditional Jewish food, usually made for Rosh Hashanah or Passover. It’s often made with carrots, potatoes, and some sort of dried fruit. This version combines the traditional carrots, potatoes and dried plums with Soy Vay® Veri Veri Teriyaki®  Marinade to introduce the delicious flavors of soy, onion, ginger, garlic, and sesame.

  • Allergens: Wheat, Soy

products.title: Apricot Glazed Mahi Mahi Bowl
products.body_html:
Bowls...they’re not just for soup anymore! We love serving this delicious meal that requires only a fork and a bowl to eat. Healthy and delicious, this dish takes just minutes to prepare but has everything going for it healthy, nutrient-packed quinoa, fresh market veggies, crunchy pine nuts and delicious mahi mahi . The sweet and salty glaze of apricot and tamari tie it all together. Now let’s get cooking!

  • Est. Cooking Time: 20 min
  • Allergens: Tree Nut, Soy, Fish
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:

products.body_html:
Bowls are in these days, baby. This healthy recipe lets you build your own quinoa bowl by combining veggies, pine nuts, mahi mahi and mixing it together with a sweet and salty apricot tamari glaze. Mahi mahi contains a ton of protein too, so you can power through that late-night work sesh.

products.title: Arctic Char
products.body_html:
A friend of mine who is a chef from Guam introduced me to Finadene. It may be new to you, but it’s a delicious staple on every table there. It’s a salty, sour, spicy all-purpose sauce and condiment with a base of soy, vinegar and citrus. The bowl continually gets refilled with various ingredients as they are eaten, and the base sauce ends up having a life span of weeks as fresh ingredients are added. It’s the perfect accompaniment to this lovely, delicate fish!

  • Est. Cooking Time: 45 min
  • Allergens: Soy, Fish
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:
  • Nutrition Facts

Suggested Pairings:

  • Champagne
  • Hefeweizen

products.title: Argentinean-Style Backwoods Barbecued Ribs
products.body_html:
Inspired by his recent trek into the Argentinian Patagonia and his camping adventures across the American National Parks, this recipe draws upon the asado-style cooking techniques of South American Guachos. Leveraging smoldering grills, massive carnal hunks of meat, and simple, yet bold seasonings to slowly cultivate the most succulent, pull-from-the-bone ribs. All of this is paired with a seductive chimichurri potato salad. 

  • Est. Cooking Time: 3 hr
  • Allergens: Wheat
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:

products.title: Arroz con Pollo
products.body_html:
After black beans, this is perhaps the most requested dish at any Cuban restaurant. You should know that nothing – and I mean nothing – compares to homemade Arroz con Pollo. The dry, pale, yellow rice with the equally dismal looking chicken that is served at most restaurants and “food by the pound” places (the horror!) are not what we are making here. The homemade result is substantially more satisfying.

The patties are basted with a rich Worcestershire and ketchup sauce then layered into an incredible burger with the addition of a fried egg, sliced beets, and fresh arugula. Baked Parmesan fries are the perfect side dish, adding a bold twist to an already delectable meal.

products.title: Arugula Salad with Gorgonzola Vinaigrette
products.body_html:
This hearty meal features roasted potatoes infused with woodsy rosemary. Crisp radish, fresh cucumbers, golden tomatoes, velvety avocado and peppery arugula get tumbled in a creamy dressing that’s spiked with just enough horseradish to keep things interesting. Brioche croutons add a buttery crunch–if you can stop yourself from eating them right out of the oven!

  • Est. Cooking Time: 30 min
  • Allergens: Dairy, Egg, Wheat, Soy, Fish
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:

products.title: Arugula Salad with Gorgonzola Vinaigrette
products.body_html:
This hearty meal features roasted potatoes infused with woodsy rosemary. Crisp radish, fresh cucumbers, golden tomatoes, velvety avocado and peppery arugula get tumbled in a creamy dressing that’s spiked with just enough horseradish to keep things interesting. Brioche croutons add a buttery crunch–if you can stop yourself from eating them right out of the oven!

  • Est. Cooking Time: 30 min
  • Allergens: Dairy, Egg, Wheat, Soy, Fish

  • Spice Level:

products.title: Arugula, Ricotta, and Olive Oil Pizzettes
products.body_html:
Crispy, chewy crust, creamy ricotta, and refreshing, peppery arugula come together in this divine pizza – perfect for the summer. This pizza will rival that of your favorite pizza parlor, in part thanks to being cooked on the grill. You’ll be able to better recreate the flavors and textures of pizza cooked on the grill because the grill can get so much hotter than an oven, reaching temperatures of up to 600 degrees.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 45 min
  • Allergens: Dairy, Wheat
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:
  • Nutrition Facts

products.title: Asian Baked Salmon
products.body_html:
Bok choy is the perfect, crunchy complement to the rich and silky salmon in this dish. After cooking, the bok choy manages to be both crispy and soft, as the stem retains a wonderful crisp texture and the leaves wilt down. Seasoned with a tamari-lemon marinade, this meal feels like a decadent indulgence, but is highly nutritious.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 45 min
  • Allergens: Dairy, Soy, Fish
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:
  • Nutrition Facts

  • Small Bowl

products.title: Asian BBQ Chicken Sandwiches
products.body_html:
This crowd pleasing chicken sandwich is sure to be a hit. Soy Vay® Asian Honey BBQ Marinade and Sauce is full of delicious sweet honey and smoky BBQ flavor to help you create a memorable and flavorful meal in minutes. This sandwich is perfection - the crunchy and refreshing coleslaw complements the tender chicken, pairing perfectly with crispy potatoes.

  • Est. Cooking Time: 45 min
  • Allergens: Dairy, Egg, Wheat, Soy
  • Skill Level:
  • Spice Level:
  • Nutrition Facts

Suggested Pairings:

  • Pinot Grigio
  • Amber Ale

  • Brioche Buns
  • Mayonnaise
  • Sugar
  • Soy Vay Asian Honey BBQ Sauce Marinade
  • Rice Wine Vinegar
  • Chicken Thighs
  • Lemon
  • Russet Potato
  • Coleslaw Mix

EQUIPMENT YOU'LL NEED:

  • Large Sauté Pan

  • Black Pepper
  • Olive Oil
  • Vegetable Oil

products.title: Asian BBQ Turkey Burgers
products.body_html:
This turkey burger is the stuff of dreams - the word "bland" won't even cross your mind. The Soy Vay® Asian Honey BBQ Marinade and Sauce gives the turkey burger a savory and smoky BBQ flavor balanced with sweet honey, making for a perfectly seasoned burger. Topped with the crunchy and refreshing coleslaw this burger will satisfy even the most die-hard beef lover.

  • Allergens: Dairy, Egg, Wheat, Soy
